title: Basic features
text: data() function conveniance function works two tasks: search retrieval. argument matches one table ids titles, data() function return tibble matched data tables. exactly one matching data table found, data() function return data table. example, data("väestö") search data find multible data tables, return matches. contrast, data("StatFin/synt/statfin_synt_pxt_12dx.px") return specific data table. function data() meant rapid exploration, production context better use specific functions. separate tasks search retrieval, use functions data_search() data_get(). Use data_get() return data table given table id, fail match exists. example, use data_get("StatFin/synt/statfin_synt_pxt_12dx.px") guarantee either data table error returned. function data_search() allows search return matching table ids, without downloading actual data. example, search data tables related “väestö”, use:

what: Covid and housing conditions in Finnish municipalities
title: Examples
code:
laaja_kuutio <-   data("tidy/laaja_kuutio") %>%   filter(     Tiedot %in% c("Kerrostaloissa asuvat asuntokunnat, %", "Väkiluku"),   ) %>%   group_by(`Alue 2021`, Tiedot) %>%     filter(time == max(time)) %>%     select(`Alue 2021`, Tiedot, value) %>%     pivot_wider(names_from = Tiedot) tartunnat <-   data("tidy/thl_kunnat") |>   filter(time == max(time)) inner_join(tartunnat, laaja_kuutio, by = c("Alue" = "Alue 2021")) %>%   mutate(Ilmaantuvuus = 100*1000*value/Väkiluku) %>%   drop_na() %>%   ggplot(aes(`Kerrostaloissa asuvat asuntokunnat, %`, Ilmaantuvuus)) +   geom_smooth() +   geom_point(aes(size = Väkiluku/1000)) +   scale_size_continuous(breaks = c(10, 50, 200, 500)) +   labs(     title = paste0("Koronavirustartuntojen ilmaantuvuus ja
",                    "kerrostaloissa asuvien asuntokuntien osuus kunnittain"),     subtitle = "Tartuntoja 100 000 asukasta kohden",     size = "Kunnan
väkiluku
(tuhatta)",     caption = paste0(       "Lähteet: THL ja Tilastokeskus.
THL:n tartuntatiedot ",       format(data_vintage("epirapo/covid19case"), "%e. %Bta %Y.")     )   )

what: The history of births and deaths in Finland
title: Examples
code: data("StatFin/synt/statfin_synt_pxt_12dx.px", tidy_time = TRUE) %>%   filter(Tiedot %in% c("Elävänä syntyneet", "Kuolleet")) %>%   ggplot(aes(time, value/1000, color = Tiedot)) +   geom_line() +   labs(     title = "Elävänä syntyneet ja kuolleet Suomessa",     subtitle = "Tuhatta henkeä",     caption = "Lähde: Tilastokeskus.",     x=NULL, y=NULL   )

what: Economic sentiment in selected European countries
title: Examples
code: data("ec/esi_nace2§(Fin|Swe|Ger)§sentiment§2015-01-01") %>%   ggplot(aes(time, value, color = Country)) +   geom_line() +   labs(     title = "Economic Sentiment Indicator",     subtitle = "Composite index (average = 100)",     caption = "Source: European Commission.",     x=NULL, y=NULL   )

title: Filtering large data tables
text: data tables returned regular tibble objects, datasources contain large tables require filtering source. example, OECD database usually requires filtering data anything can retrieved. convenience, Robonomist provides easy--use workflow fetch data. OECD SDMX-ML api, oecd dataset based, become unstable recently. recommened using new oecd3 database, uses SDMX-json api reliable. initial data request (e.g data("oecd3/QNA")) returns data structure object acts much like regular tibble, yet contain actual data. object printed like tibble, can handled common dplyr verbs filter distinct magrittr pipe using %>%. data structure object filtered, actual data can collected collect(). Also common dplyr verbs require actual data trigger collect function automatically.

title: Special datasources
text: St. Louis Fed Database FRED contain +800k time series. avoid filling Robonomist Server table content, individual time series FRED directly visible search function. Instead, can list “sources” “releases” : database hierarchy simple: Sources contain releases, releases contain time series. list releases, example, source 1 (Board Governors Federal Reserve System), call: list time series first release list (Industrial Production Capacity Utilization), call: download time series, use get_data function: can also retrieve multiple time series providing vector ids:  FRED api also allows basic time series transformations units parameter:  Allowed values units: lin = Levels (transformation) chg = Change ch1 = Change Year Ago pch = Percent Change pc1 = Percent Change Year Ago pca = Compounded Annual Rate Change cch = Continuously Compounded Rate Change cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate Change log = Natural Log Similarly time series can temporally aggregated frequency aggregation_method parameters:  Allowed values frequency: d = Daily w = Weekly bw = Biweekly m = Monthly q = Quarterly sa = Semiannual = Annual Allowed values aggregation_method: avg = Average sum = Sum eop = End Period

title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
text: robonomistClient package allows easy fast access various datasources connecting Robonomist Data Server. Currently client package provides access 78 913 --date data tables 49 different datasources 9 different languages. integrated datasources: Statistics Finland (StatFin & StatFin archive databases) Statistics Finland municipal data (Key figures & Financial data) Paavo postal code area statistics Statistics Finland Experimental statistics Statistics Finland Immigrants integration database Statistics Finland Finnish Tax Administration Finnish Centre Pensions Natural Resources Institute Finland (Luonnonvarakeskus LUKE) Traficom database (Finnish Transport Communications Agency) Customs Finland THL Sotkanet Vipunen, Education Statistics Finland Helsingin seudun aluesarjat -tilastotietokanta Helsingin ympäristötilasto Fingrid TutkiHallintoa.fi (Valtiokonttori) Eurostat European Commission Business consumer surveys World Bank OECD European Central Bank (ECB) Statistical data warehouse Deutsche Bundesbank time series database COVID-19 data (THL Epirapo, ECDC, covid19datahub.io) Statistics Sweden Swedish National Institute Economic Research Swedish Agricultural Agency Statistics Norway Statistics Denmark Statistics Iceland Statistics Estonia United Nations Economic Commission Europe Statistical Database United Nations Conference Trade Development FAO, Food Agriculture Organization United Nations Nordic Statistics Database U.S. Energy Information Administration database FRED, Federal Reserve Economic Data, St. Louis Fed Entso-E Transperancy Platform Robonomist’s curated tidy data tables setup Robonomist Data Server organization, please contact team@robonomist.com.

code: data(   pattern = "",   dl_filter = NULL,   labels = TRUE,   lang = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE,   tidy_time = NULL,   ... )  data_get(   id,   dl_filter = NULL,   labels = TRUE,   lang = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE,   tidy_time = NULL,   ... )  data_search(pattern = "")

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
text: pattern string, Search query table id, possibly followed §-filter. dl_filter list named vector passed datasource download functions filtering incoming data. Supported tulli, OECD ECB. labels logical, datasources can return labelled coded data. lang Two-letter language code, e.g. "en" "sv". na.rm Px-file based datasources return table combination categories. Missing values can filtered reading file improve preformance. tidy_time logical, TRUE, time dimension parsed Date class renamed time. NULL, datasource specific default used. ... Datasource-specific arguments. TODO id, string, Exact robonomist_id

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
text: data() function allows special §-filter. pattern matches single table function returns data frame, §-filter can used subset rows data frame. tibble filterd sequence regular expressions separated section sign §. regular expression applied data frame's variables sequentially. last variable date, used start date filter.

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
text: datasources (e.g. ECB & Tulli) allow downloading full data tables, always preferred due large table size. datasources user must provide download filter via dl_filter argument. argument left NULL,  data function return list variables potential values. list can used construct suitable download filter. Generally, dl_filter named list names variable names values character vectors selected values (see Examples). Alternatively, datasources allow dot-separated string define download filter.

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
code: if (FALSE) {  ## Return information on the data table structure  data("ecb/AME")  ## Example of download filter  data("ecb/AME", dl_filter = list(ame_ref_area = "FIN"))   data(    "ecb/FM",    dl_filter = list(freq = "M",                     provider_fm_id = "EURIBOR1YD_")  )  data("ecb/FM", dl_filter = "M.U2.EUR.RT.MM.EURIBOR1YD_.HSTA")   data("tulli/uljas_cpa2008",       dl_filter = list("Tavaraluokitus CPA2008_2" = "*A-X",                        "Aika" = c("201505", "201506"),                        "Maa" = "=ALL",                        "Suunta" = "=FIRST 1",                        "Indikaattorit" = "=FIRST 1")) }
